intro: Micranthes pensylvanica var. forbesii, commonly known as Forbes' wintergreen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly wavy margin. The small, greenish-white flowers appear in dense clusters and bloom in early spring, adding a subtle ornamental value to the plant.
